Eileen Wagner

I am a masters student at the Institute for Logic, Language and Computation in Amsterdam.

My areas of interest are philosophy of logic and mathematics, metaphysics, and the history of analytic philosophy.

I studied philosophy at Trinity College, Cambridge.

I am originally from Berlin, where I attended the John F. Kennedy School.

Currently, I am working for the Open Knowledge Foundation. Among other things, I support PR at Code for Germany.

Here is my site at Academia.edu. You can find me on Ello. I also tweet.

Blog

This is my very much neglected blog.
